comments.body: LOG(FATAL) everywhere is a bit harsh, should we consider StatusOr or Status instead?

We seem to have LOG(FATAL)  all over this file. Think part of the reason is that this code is within a constructor, and that limits our options of being able to bubble up the error status. 

Also FATAL maybe harsh, but it helps you get to the root cause faster, since if the call to miopen fails, things have already gone downhill

> Think part of the reason is that this code is within a constructor, and that limits our options of being able to bubble up the error status

I'm fine with not changing it in this CL, but then the proper way would be to move this code to a static factory which can actually return bad Status?

If you move the trailing ';' from the STREAM_EXECUTOR_MIOPEN_WRAP macros to the call site ('__macro(...);') you don't need to disable clang-format. Clang-format will then also convert the tabs hidden in the whitespace below.

What you are saying is correct, but it would make this macro inconsistent with all the other STREAM_EXECUTOR_*_WRAP macros in the rocm*.cc and cuda*.cc files. I would prefer that this be kept as is. Is that okay?

> Is that okay?
Yes, absolutely fine.
